frameDefinitions: An object Theme moves in the direction of a Goal.
In this frame, an Entity or Behavior is suspicious or otherwise subject to question.
A Donor transfers a Theme from a Donor to a Recipient.
A Deliverer hands off a Theme to a Recipient or (more indirectly) a Goal location, which is accessible to the Recipient.
A Sender plans the Path (along with Source and Goal) of a Theme and places it in circumstances such that it travels along this Path under the power of some entity other than the Sender.
frameExamples: Some students <t>arrived</t> at the school on Sunday.
We found some <t>suspicious</t> checks lying on his desk.
The staff of Ebags <t>delivered</t> the umbrella well ahead of schedule.
I <t>sent</t> the manuscript to England to Bill.
listRoleDefinitions: <fen>Theme</fen> is the object that moves. It may be an entity that moves under its own power, but it need not be.
<fen>Goal</fen> is any expression that tells where the <fen>Theme</fen> ends up, or would end up, as a result of the motion.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when arriving occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the arriving event occurs.
The <fen>Behavior</fen> is the state of affairs or action of the social actor that is regarded as susipcious.
An individual that is suspected of wrongdoing because of the <fen>Behavior</fen>.
The <fen>Entity</fen> metonymically stands in for a <fen>Behavior</fen> that saliently involves the <fen>Entity</fen>.
The person that begins in possession of the <fen>Theme</fen> and causes it to be in the possession of the <fen>Recipient</fen> .
The entity that ends up in possession of the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The object that changes ownership.
The <fen>Time</fen> is when the <fen>Donor</fen> gives the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Recipient</fen>.
The <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Donor</fen> gives the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Recipient</fen>.
This is the person who completes the movement of the <fen>Theme</fen> after having transported it.
The end of the path and intended goal of the sending.
The objects being delivered.
This is the <fen>Recipient</fen> of the sent <fen>Theme</fen>.
When the delivery takes place
The location at which the delivery takes place.
This is the person who initiates the movement of the <fen>Theme</fen> and, unlike Carrying, does not accompany it.

The end of the path and intended goal of the sending.
I <t>sent</t> the logs <fex name='Goal'>to the shed</fex>.

The objects being sent.
I mailed <fex name='Theme'>the books</fex> <fex name='Goal'>to Alaska</fex>.
Note that <fen>Theme</fen> may be multiply instantiated.
They <t>mailed</t><fex name='Theme'>a questionnaire</fex> <fex name='Theme'>with a return envelope</fex>.

The mode of sending employed.
I <t>shipped</t> <fex name='Theme'>the crops</fex> <fex name='Transport_means'>by bigrig </fex>.

This is the recipient of the sent <fen>Theme</fen>.
<fex name='Sender'>Tess</fex> <t>mailed</t> <fex name='Theme'>a letter</fex> <fex name='Recipient'> to Abby</fex>
When the sending takes place
A spatial setting encomnpassing the Source location, where the Sending event takes place.
A force, process, or event that produces an effect.
Agents in a joint or reciprocal action (e.g. exchange)
A positive or negative evaluation of the Phenomenon.
An entity which participates in a <fen>Cause</fen>, perhaps volitionally and perhaps not.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
listRoleExamples: That afternoon, <fex>a staff courier</fex> delivered the box from St. Petersburg to Largo.
I delivered the packages <fex>to the storage room</fex>.
I delivered <fex>the documents</fex> to the court house.
Tess delivered a package <fex>to Abby and her kitty</fex>.
I delivered the letter to you <fex>last week</fex>, Sir.
Barney delivered the letter on Monday <fex>in Sheboygan</fex>
I sent the letter to you <fex>last week</fex>.
Barney posted the letter on Monday <fex>in Athens</fex>
<fex>That one stone</fex>, apparently, caused the avalanche that engulfed square miles of forest.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: Big Data as a Service Market — Growth, Trends
